meanings.definition: To remove from the position of a priest or minister.
meanings.sent1: The bishop decided to unfrock the priest for his misconduct.
meanings.sent2: The church had to unfrock the minister due to his unethical behavior.
meanings.sent3: It was quite a sight to see the bishop unfrock the priest during the ceremony.
meanings.sent4: The decision to unfrock the minister was like stripping away his identity.
meanings.sent5: The act of unfrocking the priest was a solemn and irreversible one.

meanings.definition: To strip of the rank or privileges of a priest or minister.
meanings.sent1: The congregation was shocked to hear that they would unfrock the beloved pastor.
meanings.sent2: It is a serious matter to unfrock a clergy member in the church community.
meanings.sent3: The decision to unfrock the priest caused quite a stir among the parishioners.
meanings.sent4: Unfrocking the minister felt like taking away his cloak of authority.
meanings.sent5: The act of unfrocking the priest symbolized the end of his spiritual leadership.
